Case_ID.description: Unique identifier for each patient case or study participant.

Tumor/Normal.description: Indicates the nature of the biological sample. The observed value 'TN' may represent a specific sample status, such as a Tumor/Normal paired sample.

Age.description: Age of the patient in years at the time of data collection or diagnosis.

BMI.description: Body Mass Index (BMI) of the patient, a measure of body fat based on height and weight. Calculated as weight in kilograms divided by the square of height in meters.

Race.description: The self-reported or observed racial background of the individual.

Ethnicity_Self_Identify.description: The self-identified ethnicity of the individual.

Tumor_Site.description: The primary anatomical location where the tumor was identified.

Tumor_Site_Other.description: Detailed description of the tumor site when the primary location is categorized as "Other".

Tumor_Size_cm.description: The maximum dimension of the tumor, measured in centimeters.

Tumor_Focality.description: Indicates whether the tumor is present as a single lesion (Unifocal) or multiple distinct lesions (Multifocal).

Histologic_Type.description: The specific histological classification or type of the tumor, determined by microscopic examination of tissue.

Grade.description: The histological grade of the tumor, indicating its degree of differentiation and aggressiveness, typically on a scale from G1 to G4.

Tumor_Stage_Pathological.description: The overall pathological stage of the tumor, based on a comprehensive assessment (e.g., TNM system) after surgical removal and microscopic examination.

Path_Stage_Primary_Tumor_pT.description: The pathological T (primary tumor) component of the TNM staging system, describing the size and extent of the primary tumor based on post-surgical examination.

Path_Stage_Reg_Lymph_Nodes_pN.description: Pathological N (nodes) stage indicating the extent of regional lymph node involvement in cancer, as per the TNM classification system.
